description: Maximum value of factorials mod n.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(15)=9 since factorials are 1, 2, 6, 24, 120, 720, etc. which mod 15 are 1, 2, 6, 9, 0, 0, etc. and the greatest value is 9.
mathematica: With[{fctrls=Factorial[Range[100]]}, Table[Max[Mod[Take[fctrls,n], n]], {n,100}]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 03 2011 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 11 2001
